attributes.action: Increase funding on nursing homes to lower the cost of carehomes for families.
attributes.background: We visited a nursing home and were disheartened by the patients' solitude. Our hearts were torn by watching the elderly in care being so fragile and frail, armed with the knowledge that they receive such little funding. So we have started a campaign in conjunction with this

attributes.action: Parliament to debate a motion of no confidence in the current British Government
attributes.background: The recent foreign policy moves to remove the UK from the EU regardless of the damage it will do and the invite of Donald Trump to come to the UK on a State Visit  indicates a government that acts without care or diligence and is losing the confidence of much of the electorate each passing day.
attributes.additional_details: Much of the decisions being made by the current government appear disjointed, taken purely for short term reasons and to please only a portion of the electorate rather than for the greater good of all of the citizens of the four nations of these islands. The hasty invite to Donald Trump to meet the Queen now points to a government with an overall agenda that is ill-conceived. As such they are not fit to govern and a general election should be called.

attributes.action: Owners of UK media should be registered to vote and pay taxes within the UK.
attributes.background: Our democracy requires balanced and accountable news media. Part of the 'fit and proper person' test for owning a significant portion of our media should be that they are eligible to vote and pay taxes, so that they, like the rest of us, are fully part of the political environment they help shape.

attributes.action: Establish economic tests to assess readiness for Brexit.
attributes.background: The decision to leave the European Union will have huge consequences for the United Kingdom. The economic tests that were created to assess readiness for EMU provide a model for taking proper account of the economic consequences prior to notifying the EU of our intention to leave under Article 50.
attributes.additional_details: Various attempts have been made to estimate the cost to the UK of Brexit. Such an estimate has to take into account potential loss of trade, inward investment and joint R&D, as well as additional spending on the military, borders, redundancy and pensions, and bureaucracy. This is against the background of record debt (approx. 90% GDP). Parliament should establish metrics for the economic impact of each Brexit scenario (e.g. so-called hard or soft) so that an informed decision can be made.

attributes.action: Scrap or Amend the TV Licence to be a subscription service and decriminalise it
attributes.background: The TV Licence is an outdated concept. We now have many choices for subscription based services such as Amazon, BT, Sky, and Virgin Media. Why must we pay money to these as well as the BBC!? The Licence is also NOT means tested. Why should someone on £30,000 a year pay the same as someone on £7000?
attributes.additional_details: 7,000 homes have blocked visits by enforcement officers by removing the 'Implied right of access' to their properties. At the very least this should be decriminalised. Many cannot afford the fee and are facing a criminal record, when previously having no record at all.

attributes.action: Petition to finally shut down Dogs4Us and eradicate all puppy farming.
attributes.background: Puppy farming is still rife in the country and as a result thousands of animals are inhumanely treated and forced to breed. Millions of families receive animals who are in poor health and have numerous defects. Sadly many of these animals come from organisations like Dogs4Us. Lets stop this now.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs4Us has been exposed by numerous reputable news outlets yet the suffering still continuous. Together we can stop this abuse and shut down places like dogs4us as well as banning the act of puppy farming once and for all.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on the US as Trump threatens human rights, speech & environment
attributes.background: After a few days in office Trump has resurrected plans for oil pipelines opposed by the people, stripped funding from reproductive services, put gag orders on US government agencies and is planning to start building a border wall. Anywhere else these actions would be recognised as dictatorial.
attributes.additional_details:
Trump's actions will affect the environment to an irreversible degree, force women to fall back on dangerous abortion methods. Free speech and movement will be impeded. Please show him that the UK does not condone his dictatorial and divisive actions early on by imposing economic sanctions on the USA. If he does not get challenged things will get worse.

http://tinyurl.com/hzarqrq 
http://tinyurl.com/zsctvbm 
http://tinyurl.com/hyoe3fd 
http://tinyurl.com/h4pm5vf
http://tinyurl.com/hlsycfp

attributes.action: Amend prior approval for phone masts to include a minimum distance from houses
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum distance stipulated for masts. They are cautious not to site masts next to playgrounds and schools but are happy to site them next to residential gardens with established play areas. Neighbours should actually be consulted prior to the submission of an application.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous examples across the country of mobile phone companies exploiting the relaxed planning rules by trying to site masts within so called 'breaks in the residential nature of the search area'. If the LPA does not refuse or grant an application for prior approval within 56 days its prior approval is automatically deemed to have been given and the mast can be built even if it is within a few metres of a residential property. The process needs to be far more transparent.

attributes.action: Enforce tougher penalties for mobile phone use while driving.
attributes.background: While driving around the country with work, I witness far too many drivers all over the road because they are using their mobile phones, mainly in their hands, while driving. This is mostly texting or typing. The current fine and penalty points are far too low and the penalty must be higher.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who text on the road are in far more danger than intoxicated drivers.

A Techtimes study results show those who occupied themselves with text messages, either by reading or writing them, had slower reactions times by 35%. By comparison, drunk drivers displayed a 12% decrease in reaction time, while drivers intoxicated with cannabis had slowed response times by 21%. http://www.techtimes.com/articles/8185/20140609/texting-is-more-dangerous-than-drugs-alcohol-while-driving-study.htm

attributes.action: Allow homosexual men to donate blood, if they have evidence of their HIV status.
attributes.background: Homosexual men are not allowed to donate blood due to the myth of HIV being active only in homosexual men. The law states that men who are homosexual and have had sex in the past year are not allowed to donate blood, whether or not they can prove they don't have HIV.

attributes.action: Elevate the Cotswolds area of outstanding natural beauty to national park status
attributes.background: The Cotswolds is already an area of outstanding natural beauty, but continues to be accosted by unsuitable development. By elevating it to become a national park, increased protections in planning law will defend its beauty for generations to come and provide a much needed Midlands national park.

attributes.action: Greyhounds to be muzzled at all times when out in public places
attributes.background: A neighbours cat was mauled to death by two greyhounds. Although the dogs were on leads the owner was unable to control them. It is law in Northern Ireland for greyhounds to be muzzled this needs to be extended to the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a new appointment process
attributes.background: We are in a situation where the house of commons appears to not represent the working class people of Great Britain. It is seen by most working class people to be an extension of the House of Lords. We need a balance of wealthy people and poor people to correctly govern the UK.
attributes.additional_details: At present we have no balance, both houses are full of highly educated individuals most from privileged backgrounds.To restore balance we need a house to represent the not so fortunate of the UK i.e low paid workers, people who live in poorer areas,  people without an education, people without the chance to change their lives. I propose we dissolve the House of Lords and replace it with a cross section of society who are selected in much the same way we already make selections for Jury service.

attributes.action: Stop street beggars from using live animals to support their begging.
attributes.background:
All over London's West End tourist spots there are gangs of Eastern Europeans using dogs to aid their begging.
The dogs are dressed up in clothes, hats and sunglasses, and are made to to sit out in all weathers for hours to attract the public and encourage them to give money.

attributes.action: Referendum before triggering article 50
attributes.background:
We the UK citizens who do not want to leave the EU want our voices heard. A referendum should be called on remaining or leaving the EU before Article 50 is triggered by the Government.
We believe that many people did not know what they were voting for on the 23rd June 2016.

attributes.action: Reduce the size of Motorcycle number plates
attributes.background: With HD cameras ANPR and better surveillance cameras the late 7 x 9 plate is not required and a more streamlined 6 x 4 plate would be adequate.  Motorcyclists can find the large plates cause drag and that also has a cost in respect of fuel usage. A smaller plate is more carbon efficient therefore.

attributes.action: Fathers to have 50/50 rights and stricter penalties for breach of court order
attributes.background: I want fathers to have equal rights in a family court and not just automatically given to the mother. Also a stronger penalty for breach of court order. With the person who is breachig the court order liable to pay costs towards a new court order.
attributes.additional_details:
Time and time again fathers are being stopped from seeing their children. Even with a visitation order, the ex partner can stop them and have to be taken back to court at the expense of the father again. 

It's a lengthy and costly process and the mother has automatic residency rights over the child. The current procedures don't do enough to stop a mother from blocking contact with their children. 

If the mother blocks contact without a valid excuse, she should be made to pay future court fees

attributes.action: Ensure every school in the UK has Bullying awareness lessons for ages 5-16
attributes.background: Bullying effects many peoples lives, touches many family's & interrupts the personal and academic growth of every child. Personally as a child back in 1993 i was affected by bullying that still makes a impact on my adulthood today. I just don't see any improvement since then to protect our children
attributes.additional_details:
This petition suggests some of the following:

Every school is required by education policy through DfE to have group discussions setting out a plan on how to help pupils report bullying, its effects and challenges throughout academic growth.

Requests each school in UK to have Bullying awareness lessons ages 5-16 at least 3 times a year.

attributes.action: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket.
attributes.background: Make it law that cyclist's have to wear a high vis jacket with reflective strips at all time when on the road and no headphones. To help them to be seen by motorists and they can hear what is happening on the road. This is after truck and car drivers are getting blamed for deaths of cyclists.

attributes.action: Move parliament away from the Palace of Westminster to Carlisle, Cumbria
attributes.background: London-centric government leads to a distorted view of the UK and a disproportionate distribution of resource. The Northern Power House discussion mistakenly sees the Merseyside/Manchester/Leeds axis as the North of England. Government from Carlisle will shift more than just the base of politics.
attributes.additional_details: The problems of poor infrastructure, transport and communication can be ignored while the British Government continues to rule from Westminster. The North East has at least reasonable transport links; Cumbria boasts two lane trunk roads. Much of Cumbria has poor mobile signal and even poorer broadband.  What might change if the Government had to try to function in that environment.  This time Cumbria, after 10 years perhaps another northern county, then perhaps Cornwall!

attributes.action: Instruct Royal Mail to change its opt-out scheme for junk mail to an opt-in one.
attributes.background: Royal Mail earns over £1.3 bn each year from junk mail deliveries. (It calls it "unaddressed mail"). It offers an opt-out service, but this does not work. An opt-in system would ensure that only those who wish to receive junk mail receive it.
attributes.additional_details: The opt-out system does not work: there is no confirmation of a successful application to opt-out; the opt-out only lasts for two years; there is no notification of the end date; and there is no invitation to renew the opt-out at the end of the two year period. In spite of all the hurdles put in place by Royal Mail, junk mail still gets delivered. The system in place does not work, so it needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Change the way Statutory Redundancy Payments are calculated please
attributes.background:
The current SRP is calculated by using your present salary only and this needs to change.  Working people that previously held full time roles within their company cannot use these years at the higher salary rate to calculate their final payment.  
A fair adjustment mechanism needs to be created.
attributes.additional_details:
Mum works part time for the last five years after giving birth but, had previously worked full time in the same role for ten years.  
The company decides to restructure and her role is made redundant.
Mum can only claim 15 years service at the part time salary.  
Result, greatly reduced final payment.
The full time salary should be used to calculate the 10 years working full time hours and part time salary to calculate the remaining 5 years.
Result, fair SRP using company records.

attributes.action: Car tax exemption for cars over 30 years old
attributes.background: Classic cars between 30 and 40 years old have to be Taxed. There needs to be more of an incentive for owners to keep these cars going. Many cars of this age are in need of restoration, they are likely uneconomical to repair. This is the way forward to encourage the protection of classic cars

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for cinemas to provide access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.background:
1 in 6 people in the UK have some form of hearing loss or deafness, this accounts for 11 million people, with over 900,000 having a severe or profound deafness. 

Fewer than 1% of cinema screening are currently subtitled, we would like to see an increase in access for those with hearing loss.
attributes.additional_details:
On January 17th 2017, it becomes mandatory for all cinemas showing digital films within the United States of America to provide closed-caption personal subtitling devices at every showing. This means that open screen subtitling, which is infrequently programmed, isn't the only option for patrons with hearing loss. 

We believe that the UK should follow suit and provide proper access to those with hearing loss that wish to access the cinema.

attributes.action: Reduce the annual income for a spousal visa to be in line with living wage
attributes.background:
The spousal visa requirement means that I must be earning £18,600 a year (and increases with dependents) To even be consider for the visa means that most people cannot afford to be in love.
I myself work two well paid jobs and still don't meet the criteria. This means my husband cannot join me.
attributes.additional_details:
The visa requirement would be much fairer for all if it was in line with the living wage and would stop the separation of 43% of family's.

This requirement has been a problem for many families for a long time and something needs to change. 

https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/feb/21/families-challenge-minimum-income-visa-rules-supreme-court-non-eu-partner 

There should not be a price to pay for being happy and in love.

attributes.action: Close hospitality establishments over the Christmas period.
attributes.background: Christmas is a family time, hospitality workers work extremely hard during the Christmas run up and many don't get Christmas day off, nevermind boxing day. Some things are needed over the festive period; eating out isn't one of them.
attributes.additional_details: As a chef, it is expected that I will work over the festive period, including Christmas day, boxing day and all bank holidays, with no extra incentive.   I fully support retail workers having Christmas day AND Boxing day off, but this should be extended to those who work in hospitality too. This is especially important for those who work away from their hometowns, as one day off is not long enough to get home to see their family and means a Christmas day spent alone.

attributes.action: Stop car insurance companies increasing prices after a non-fault accident.
attributes.background: Currently, insurers can charge more for customers who have been involved in a non- fault accident in the past 5 years. As an 18 year old, I was involved in one and my insurance costs went up by 20% as a result. I fail to see why people who are not at fault for an accident should be punished for it.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties and punishments for bullies in school
attributes.background: Recently more and more children are being bullied and the incident is being posted on social media we need to show this is wrong and have stronger penalties and punishment for such behaviour to deter other people from doing it and show them this type of behaviour is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details: boy 11 died due to bullying 29.9.16

attributes.action: Mandatory vision and reaction check-up for all 75+ with a UK Driving license.
attributes.background: I have had personal experience of elderly drivers on wrong side of the road, being oblivious to cyclists, pulling out on roundabouts not noticing vehicles, stopping in main roads and causing serious collisions due to poor sight and reactions.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 5 over 75 year olds in the UK are suffering with vision loss; and from research I have found there are approximately 4 Million drivers over the age of 70 on UK roads.

The current system in place allows the individual to self-assess and to alert the DVLA if they are not fit to drive. In many cases if the individual needs the car for transport they will be reluctant to inform of any changes in health, vision etc. Completing a fast assessment will eliminate any possibility of this.

attributes.action: Stop the production of the 1 pence coins.
attributes.background:
The rate of inflation has made 1 pence coins virtually unusable. 
Canada has already removed its lowest value currency from circulation.
If the cost to produce one Canadian Penny is 1.5 Canadian Cents, then we can assume it has a similar cost in the UK.
It is uneconomical to keep in circulation.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.whatdotheyknow.com/request/cost_to_produce_one_penny

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-21292441

attributes.action: Make it illegal to sell lilies without a clear label stating they kill cats.
attributes.background: Lilies are among one of the most common flowers sold in the UK. They are also toxic and fatal to the most common pet in the UK: cats. They are so lethal to cats that even just a cat brushing passed a lily and catching some pollen on its fur and then licking it off will shut down a cat's kidneys.
attributes.additional_details: My 8 month old cat passed away by coming into contact with a lily. She was in intensive care for two days, her kidneys shut down, she was aggressively twitching, she could not move and as her kidneys could not process and remove her potassium levels she died of a heart attack. All it takes is a cat to ingest the tiniest bit of pollen and they will die. How can it be that all lilies sold do not come with a clear warning? It is disgusting. I lost my sweet young girl, don't let this happen again.

attributes.action: The right for transgender men to be on a baby's birth certificate as dad!
attributes.background: Transgender men should be allowed on their partner's birth certificate as dad when the baby is through artificial insemination or Natural Insemination we are men too!! We have the right to be dads we are not adopted parents we are bringing up the child from birth!
attributes.additional_details: I have rung the registry office and been told that we 'might' be treated as lesbian couples and will have to adopt the child which in my opinion is wrong in many ways both me and my Fiancee agree on the fact that I should be dad on the birth certificate I have  been passed around to many people and still have not got an answer. I shouldn't have to question how I'm going to go onto the birth certificate I should just be able to go on it as should any other transman in our situation!

attributes.action: Fine drunks to stop the abuse of the NHS and knock-on risk to lives!
attributes.background: Introduce legislation automatically fining drunks requiring NHS ambulance/medics, to stop their NHS abuse, by turning it into the National Hang-over Service.  Ambulances and medics attending drunks are services unavailable for genuine and so more worthy emergencies, with consequential risk to life.
attributes.additional_details: Police can impose a £100 fine for “Being drunk & disorderly”. Someone so drunk requiring NHS services is defacto “drunk & disorderly” and so should be automatically fined at least £100.  Ideally introduce a new charge of “Being drunk & disorderly to the extent of requiring NHS services” with a minimum fine of £500, increased annually by £500 until the problem has been eliminated – with all monies going direct to the NHS. 31 Dec. fines should be double to fund Emergency staff double time.

attributes.action: Public inquiry into the death of Mogous Abay
attributes.background: We the undersigned consider the conduct and investigation in to the death of Mogous Abay as being riddled with inconsistencies and incompetence. We therefore call for a public inquiry into his death.
attributes.additional_details: Since 1990 there has been no serious police investigation into the death of Mogous Abay. The circumstances leading to his death are considered to be suspicious and the handling of the case by the police highlights inconsistencies. The police assumed that Mogous had committed suicide by throwing himself from the fourth floor of his flat in London. Contrary to police reports several witnesses have signed statements insisting that Mogous had come to his death before the event of a fall.

attributes.action: Open premises to homeless people when the temperature falls.
attributes.background: change the law, to require anyone who is responsible for a community centre or a sports hall to open their premises to homeless people when the temperature falls below a certain level.
attributes.additional_details: Just read a news story about a guy freezing to death on the coldest night of the year. It reached -9'c here. Its a simply request, which would help in cold weather, not a quick fix, but a start!

attributes.action: Allow GP's to be able to refer patients to out of area mental health services
attributes.background: With physical health you can request to be referred to a different hospital not in your borough through your GP. With mental health your GP can only refer you to the mental health services in your area. Patients should be able to request to go to specialised services through their GP for all health.
attributes.additional_details:
More patients are being referred back to their GP's and they can be the person who knows the patient best and need to have the option of sending the patient else where.

It could in certain situations help people get the help they need quicker if a GP can refer patients even if their service did refer them after being assessed onto somewhere that has wasted so much time and money that could've been saved if the GP and patient already knew where they needed to be referred to have the assessment.

attributes.action: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
attributes.background: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.
attributes.additional_details:
There is an alarming lack of support for people fleeing domestic abuse, especially women/families. This manifests the deprivation that families often experience moving out from an abuser or from a shelter.

"The threat of poverty is often described as being ‘among the most formidable'" barriers (NOWLDEF, 2002:1) from leaving toxic - in some cases deadly - situations with serious consequences. This hole in the social safety net is short-sighted in both its financial and societal implications.

attributes.action: Put a capping law on car insurance costs to help people get back to work.
attributes.background:
This year alone the price rise for the average car insurance is 14% and 20% in the northern regions according reports.

Although this is blamed on an increase in claims, I think we all know that the insurance company owners are rolling in it.

This is stopping our working economy.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.willistowerswatson.com/en-GB/press/2017/01/car-insurance-premiums-see-14-per-cent-annual-rise

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/nov/26/car-insurance-premium-rise-tax-hike-soaring-costs

https://www.confused.com/on-the-road/cost-of-motoring/what-the-price-index-means-for-you

attributes.action: Provide funding for organisations to train psychological support dogs.
attributes.background: There is extensive research on the positive effects dogs and other animals have on the mental well-being of humans. Providing support dogs could help people with mental illness carry out activities otherwise limited by their mental illness. It could greatly help in cases of depression or anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: I can't even begin to reference the studies carried out on the effects animals have on human health and well-being as there is so much. Studies show that animals can reduce heart rates, blood pressure and cortisol levels (stress) of humans with their presence alone. Imagine what a support dog could do for someone who struggles to leave the house due to mental illness? Having a pet helps, but with pets you are limited on where you can take them. Support dogs could help in these situations.

attributes.action: Rethink healthcare provision on the Isle of Wight
attributes.background:
We reject the STP for Hampshire and the Isle of Wight. We demand that:
Comprehensive, high quality, place based systems of care be maintained at least at their present level on the Isle of Wight
GP and dentistry services are safeguarded
Resources for community mental health services are increased
attributes.additional_details: The current Government has created record NHS deficits – £2.45 billion and rising. 3.9 million people are on waiting lists for treatment. Last year, 1.8 million people had to wait 4 or more hours in A&E – a fourfold increase since 2010. A quarter of patients have been forced to wait a week or more just to see or speak to their GP or a nurse – some cannot even get an appointment. And now the Sustainability & Transformation Plan (STP) could mean Islanders losing 30% of NHS services.

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring of "non-conventional" on porn sites
attributes.background: Age verification checks on porn websites will be hard to implement. ISPs already offer many ways to do this without having to risk personal information. If age verification is done using credit card then dodgy websites may take advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should not be allowed to decide what types of porn people are allowed to watch. As long as its consenting, over-18 adults, and it does not go against current law then it should be perfectly fine to show online.

Implementing age verification on to websites will be very risky if it uses personal information to check you are over-18. Lots of porn sites have been hacked recently so that is also a big concern. Parental controls can be easily setup so this is unneeded.

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Make pet shops pass a test before selling their animals
attributes.background: Many pet shops are giving the wrong advice about their animals, especially exotics, to first time owners and unfortunately they don't know it could be harming their pet. Pet shops should pass a test on each animal they sell to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
The main issues are:
The wrong food 
Incorrect housing size/type
Incorrect size/type wheels (wire ones injure feet)
Telling people solitary animals "need a friend"
Incorrect bedding type (usually sawdust which is avoided by most people)
Failing to tell customers that CAPTIVE BRED ANIMALS SHOULD NOT BE RELEASED INTO THE WILD

attributes.action: Another Scottish independence referendum should not be allowed to happen
attributes.background: We in Scotland are fed up of persecution by the SNP leader who is solely intent on getting independence at any cost. As a result, Scotland is suffering hugely.

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax.  It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
attributes.background:
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax

attributes.action: Make Stereotyping a compulsory subject in schools.
attributes.background: As part of a citizenship group. We believe Stereotyping is a significant topic that should be discussed as a school subject so that students can understand the causes and consequences of Stereotyping. We are a group of different ethnical and cultural backgrounds and have seen stereotyping.

attributes.action: Change the redundancy law around workers who were full time & are now part time.
attributes.background: The law is very clear, It is defined as this "it is your part-time position which is being made redundant, you are therefore being compensated for your current part-time position." This is regardless of any previous full-time service, even if that is 10+ yrs of dedication over 2 yrs of part-time.
attributes.additional_details: In my opinion, those who are affected by this are those that have had a family or are a dedicated caregiver. With years of unwavering service to their company & returning part time, how is it justifiable not to consider that service at a time when it is most needed. What if  the job specification never changed, what if you are supporting a full-time role on part-time hours, which is the majority of cases. Redundancy is based on a calculation, a formula, that formula can be adapted.

attributes.action: Make putting an offer on a house purchase in England legally binding.
attributes.background: Far too many people are being let down and are also suffering unnecessary costs from the fact that people can put an offer on a house they want to buy and then withdraw at any point before exchange without penalty.
attributes.additional_details: Buying and selling houses is such a life changing and costly process it should not be subject to people changing their minds in a whim.  Many families can suffer heartache when a house chain collapses due to a person simply changing their mind.  I propose that before people enter a bid on a house they should get a survey and any searches competed and be in a position to pay a deposit.   This would add an a strong element of security to the house buying and selling process.

attributes.action: UK govt to strongly condemn India for genocide of innocent Kashmiri muslims
attributes.background: Kashmiri muslims are asking for their right of freedom, which was conferred to them according to UN resolutions. They want Their right of plebiscite. Indian army is killing innocent and unarmed Kashmiri Muslims. Killings should be stopped immediately and Kashmiri should be invited for dialogue.
